H0.text: Angiosperms are the most successful phylum of plants.

H1.text: Spores are the most successful phylum of plants.

H2.text: Gymnosperms are the most successful phylum of plants.

H3.text: Ferns are the most successful phylum of plants.

A4.text: Angiosperms are by far the most diverse group of land plants with 64 orders, 416 families, approximately 13,000 known genera and 300,000 known species.

A5.text: In the Cretaceous, angiosperms diversified explosively, becoming the dominant group of plants across the planet.
